intro: Althoffia ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's althoffia, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanical curiosity and is often studied for its ecological role in its native regions.
